title: Stuck Pipe Prevention & Recovery
description: Stuck pipe is a costly, time-consuming problem that can escalate to well loss. In HPHT and narrow-window environments, the conditions that cause stuck pipe are amplified. Prevention through awareness is far better than recovery operations.
objectives: Identify stuck pipe mechanisms and warning signs
Implement prevention strategies for each mechanism
Execute immediate response when stuck occurs

keyTopics.content: Occurs when drillstring contacts permeable formation in overbalanced conditions. High MW OBM (like 17+ ppg) creates significant differential pressure against sands. Prevention: minimize stationary time, use low-friction muds, reduce overbalance where possible.

Key seating (from doglegs), undergauge hole, packoff from cuttings, bridging from unstable formations. All cause physical obstruction. Prevention: hole cleaning, controlled drilling parameters, wiper trips, proper trajectory.
Ledges, spiraled hole, undergauge from reactive shales. The drillstring gets mechanically trapped. Warning signs: increasing drag, difficulty getting back to bottom, fill on bottom after trips.

Increasing overpull on connections. Increasing torque trends. Difficulty getting to bottom. Erratic weight transfer. Cuttings accumulation at shakers. Tight spots. Address these BEFORE they become stuck pipe.

When stuck: note depth, string weight, and time. Do NOT apply maximum overpull immediately - this can make it worse. Attempt to work pipe with moderate overpull and rotation. Establish circulation if possible. Time is critical for differential sticking.

Spotting pills (oil-based for differential, acid for calcium-based bridges). Jarring operations. Back-off and fish. Sidetrack as last resort. In HPHT wells, prolonged stuck pipe operations risk wellbore stability and well control issues.

risks: High MW OBM (17+ ppg) = differential sticking risk in sands
Long open hole sections = cutting accumulation
Tight windows = limited ability to adjust MW for recovery

operationalPrinciples: Prevention is infinitely cheaper than recovery
Don't stop on bottom in permeable zones
Time works against you - act quickly
